question: Okay, so first of all, do you work or are you a student?
transcript: I am currently a student at the Diplomatic Academy of Vietnam. I plan to graduate around June this year, but due to the COVID-19 pandemic, that may have to be postponed.

question: So at your school, what is your favorite subject?
transcript: I think I like international communications the most because it gives me a chance to improve my interpersonal skills and to interact with other people more effectively. More effectively.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: The majority of sentences are error free.

question: Okay, so are there any subjects that you do not like?
transcript: I dislike mathematics because I am very bad in calculating and that is the reason why I chose international relations as my major because each curriculum excludes math.

anti_overrating.reason: 'bad in calculating' (bad at calculating / bad at calculations).

question: Do you often use bags?
transcript: I always use bags. I like to carry things around because I am a fan of Apple gadgets. So I have iPhone iPad or MacBook So I have to put all of these things into a bag to protect them Okay so what kinds of bags do you like If we are talking about materials, I think leather bag is my favorite kind of bag because it is very durable. So I can use it for a very long time and I do not have to spend money on a new one. Okay, thank you. So now I am going to give you a topic and I would like you to talk about it for one to two minutes.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: What kinds of people become famous nowadays?
transcript: In Vietnam, I think, the young singers and young musicians are very famous because you see, the young population of Vietnam, teenagers, they are very into music, especially, V-pop or Vietnamese popular music. So, these kinds of artists have a strong influence on, on the youngsters and they are very famous. They make a lot of money from their fame.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: So, do you think politicians and movie stars are famous and popular around the world?
transcript: I think it is, it is definitely true, but they are famous or well-known in different ways. Politicians are the decision makers of a country. So, what they say or what they do, affect a lot of people. So people, it is obvious that people have to care about, what they think and their mindset. and, and, the, the, the other ones that you mentioned, they have a cultural influence on, on people. And so I think both of these aspects people care a lot about.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses less common and idiomatic vocabulary skilfully.

question: Okay, right?
transcript: Right. So, as a child, when I live just like carefree about my life, I do not have to care about the future path. But, when I grew up, when I grow up, I have just stopped to think about my future projects. So yeah, it is a bit busy right now for me.

anti_overrating.reason: 'when I live just like carefree' (when I lived carefree). 'stopped to think about' (started to think about? Context implies busy now. 'stopped to think' means paused to think. 'start to think' fits better if now busy).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: So how do you feel when you are busy?
transcript: when I have a lot on my plate, I would definitely like spend much time for my work and I do not have time for my acquaintance and that makes me like far from my parents and yeah, I do not have much time for them.

anti_overrating.reason: 'spend much time for my work' (on my work). 'time for my acquaintance' (acquaintances / friends?). 'makes me like far from my parents' (distant from?).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: Yeah, so when was the last time that you were busy?
transcript: That was about like, on October when I just got into my university right now, it is a foreign trade university. I applied for a club and I had to do a project. I mean, I have to burn my midnight oil to do a lot of things, a lot of stuff. And yeah, that is, one time I got really busy at that time.

anti_overrating.reason: 'burn my midnight oil' (burn the midnight oil). 'on October' (in October).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: So were you busy as a child?
transcript: I mean, as I previously mentioned, my life was just carefree and I lived without thinking about my future when I was a child. But, things have changed a lot now. I mean, my life has, a lot of things came to me, so it is definitely more busier to me.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: What kind of weather do you like most?
transcript: I mean I would lean towards the cloudy weather because I am a little bit energetic so I would like to, do some outdoor activities. that is why I want the weather to be cloudy so that I can go outside and hang out with my friends.

ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: Okay, do you prefer dry or wet weather?
transcript: To be honest, that is not my go-to options because as I mentioned, windy and cloudy weather is my, like, my on top, my on top option. So yeah, I do not prefer both of them.

anti_overrating.reason: 'go-to options' (option). 'my on top option' (top option / favorite option). 'do not prefer both of them' (do not prefer either of them).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.

question: Okay, so is there any difference in the weather patterns in different parts of Vietnam?
transcript: I would say yes Vietnam contains like three main parts as I think the western the northern the southern and the middle of Vietnam And each like part has its own unique features of weather For the north side we have like two main features it is scorching hot and sometimes the weather is raining a lot But for the southern part the weather is mostly like very hot at that time but in the middle of Vietnam there were many like disastrous things in there

anti_overrating.reason: 'weather is raining a lot' (it rains a lot / rainy). 'there were many like disastrous things' (there are many disasters?).

ielts_descriptor_alignment.grammar_text: Makes some errors in grammar and punctuation.
ielts_descriptor_alignment.vocabulary_text: Uses a sufficient range of vocabulary.

question: Do people in your country enjoy watching TV programs?
transcript: I mean it depends like, for, depends on the generation. Because, for the younger generation, they often spend much of their time, sitting at home and enjoy watching TV. For example, Netflix. Or some kinds of, like, discovery program. But for the older generation, they would tend to like spend time for watching like news or kind of older generation programs like that.

anti_overrating.reason: 'spend time for watching' (spend time watching). 'enjoy watching' (correct).
